definitions.definition: ( heading ) Physical appendage. A skin tag , an excrescence of skin. A dangling lock of sheep's wool, matted with dung; a dung tag . Any slight appendage, as to an article of dress; something slight hanging loosely. A metallic binding, tube, or point, at the end of a string, or lace, to stiffen it. ( biochemistry ) Any short peptide sequence artificially attached to proteins mostly in order to help purify, solubilize or visualize these proteins. Something mean and paltry; the rabble, originally refer to rag as torn cloth.
examples: He has a tag hung on his bag.

subdefinitions.definition: The last line (or last two lines) of a song 's chorus that is repeated to indicate the end of the song.
( television ) The last scene of a TV program, often focusing on the program's subplot .
The end, or catchword , of an actor's speech; cue .
( informal , authorship ) An attribution in narrated dialogue (eg, "he said") or attributed words (e.g. "he thought").
( computing ) A piece of markup representing an element in a markup language .
examples: The <title> tag provides a title for the Web page.
The <sarcasm> tag conveys sarcasm in Internet slang.

subdefinitions.definition: ( computing ) A keyword , term, or phrase associated with or assigned to data, media, and/or information enabling keyword-based classification ; often used to categorize content.
examples: I want to add genre and artist tags to the files in my music collection.

subdefinitions.definition: ( chiefly US ) A vehicle number plate; a medal bearing identification data (animals, soldiers).
examples: The subwoofer in the trunk was so loud, it vibrated the tag like an aluminum can.

subdefinitions.definition: ( uncountable ) A game, especially for children on playgrounds , in which one player (known as "it") attempts to touch another, who then becomes "it"; any similar game of chasing and trying to reach, touch, shoot, or label other players.
( baseball ) An instance of touching the baserunner with the ball or the ball in a gloved hand to rule him "out."
examples: The tag was applied at second for the final out.

subdefinitions.definition: Graffiti in the form of a stylized signature particular to the artist.

definitions.definition: A sheep in its first year.

( biochemistry ) Any short peptide sequence artificially attached to proteins mostly in order to help purify, solubilize or visualize these proteins. Something mean and paltry; the rabble, originally refer to rag as torn cloth.

definitions.definition: A decoration drawn over some Hebrew letters in Jewish scrolls, especially in Stam style.

main_definition: A decoration drawn over some Hebrew letters in Jewish scrolls, especially in Stam style.
